unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – The nationwide smart meter deployment is accelerating, with significant installations reported across various states, including Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) continues to play a pivotal role in facilitating this transition, aiming for complete coverage by December 31, 2025.
normalised: New Delhi, India – The nationwide smart meter deployment is accelerating, with significant installations reported across various states, including Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (E E S L) continues to play a pivotal role in facilitating this transition, aiming for complete coverage by December thirty one, two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The implementation aims to reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, a perennial challenge for DISCOMs like Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited. Early adopters are already witnessing improved billing accuracy and enhanced grid management capabilities.
normalised: The implementation aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, a perennial challenge for D I S C O M s like Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited. Early adopters are already witnessing improved billing accuracy and enhanced grid management capabilities.

unnormalised: "We are committed to providing consumers with greater control over their energy consumption," stated Mr. Rajesh Kumar, Director of the Ministry of Power, at a press briefing held on 15/08/2023. The project, with an estimated investment of Rs. 75,000 crores, promises to transform India's power distribution landscape.
normalised: "We are committed to providing consumers with greater control over their energy consumption," stated Mister Rajesh Kumar, Director of the Ministry of Power, at a press briefing held on fifteenth August two thousand and twenty three. The project, with an estimated investment of rupee seventy five thousand crore, promises to transform India's power distribution landscape.

unnormalised: Consumers can access real-time energy usage data via a dedicated mobile application, promoting energy conservation. A pilot project in Gandhinagar, Gujarat, showcased a 15% reduction in average household energy consumption between 09:00 hrs and 17:00 hrs. The next phase focuses on integrating rooftop solar panels with the smart meter infrastructure by October 26, 2023.
normalised: Consumers can access real-time energy usage data via a dedicated mobile application, promoting energy conservation. A pilot project in Gandhinagar, Gujarat, showcased a fifteen percent reduction in average household energy consumption between nine hours and seventeen hours. The next phase focuses on integrating rooftop solar panels with the smart meter infrastructure by October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three.
